# Function


The Serratus Anterior (along with the rhomboids) serves to aid in scapular stability during arm elevation @duttonDuttonOrthopaedicExamination2020 

![Superior View of the shoulder: You can see how the rhomboids and SA both actively stabilize the scapulothoracic joint by pulling the scapula towards the thoracic wall @duttonDuttonOrthopaedicExamination2020](/The Archive/Anatomy/OIANs/Shoulder and Arm Muscles/images/Dutton fig16.2 Superior aspect of shoulder.png)
